ratings.comment: Great professor. Although his style may be different it is very effective. Despite popular belief the homework is actually related to the tests and lectures. Discussion helped clarify and explain some problems with the homework, and problems in general. Lecture is very important. Tests can be hard but not worse than other classes.

Who ever heard of actually doing work for a class? Should be expected. Yes, there's a lot of homework but it is a great way to learn the material. Lectures supplement the book, which is entirely necessary, and make the homework a lot easier. Hard exams, but not unreasonably so.

A lot of homework every week!!! Assigns boring extra homework which is unhelpful to exams at all! The person is nice, but he really doesn't know how to teach. Very harsh grader, a small calculation mistake on exams would lose many points.
Professor Drake is really patient and clear about teaching. He is very patient to every student and he gives extra questions to encourage us to solidify our understanding. A perfect teacher!

I'm actually pretty good at math but I end up with bad grades in this course. He is a nice person, but does not know how to teach. He assigns tons of hw which is unrelated to the exams or lecture. Exams are not hard but are unrelated to what you do in HW. I would do much better is he were more clearer on expectations from us.

class format was bad, lecture & discussion. discussion wound up being me and 3-5 other people it was so bad, couldn't understand TA's english. clicker questions were unhelpful. book wasn't worth the post stamp. drake comes across as a nice person but i'd like him to teach better and be mean.
this website willn't let me write anything here, get error all the time

Lots of homework. Hard grader on exam problems. If you have a calculation error in an exam question that worth 12points in total, about 6 points would be deducted due to an error like (-1)(-2) -2. If you want to get good grade, you must devote lots of time to study every week. Remember, every week!!!

He presents things very clearly in lecture but there are not a ton of examples and the homework is considerably different and harder than what is done in lecture. He seems like a good guy though and wants his students to do well and understand the content.

Course is very difficult because it's one of the first super theoretical math courses. Clicker questions daily force you to go to lecture which is good, but they're generally difficult - luckily only graded on completion. Homework takes forever and is graded on quality, no one ever gets 100%. Dan is a nice guy, though. Would recommend.

Likes to use words to explain concepts. Problem with that is the subject matter is so abstract that you get lost in the middle of the sentence. Also expects you to know answers to clicker questions right after learning particularly difficult concepts.

Dan is a good prof. This class is meant to be largely self-taught with the online textbook. The class times were really for review and to ask questions. I didn't like the online tests because it was more about learning what format the computer would accept than it was about doing actual math. Overall a relatively easy course if you put in effort.

Class is super easy and Dan is an awesome professor. I agree he does move a little slow, but he really cares about people getting the basic ideas and fundamentals down. Great at communicating difficult topics in easier language. He took the time to help me later in Calc 1 and 2. One of the best and nicest professors on this campus for sure.

He is the director of the math department and I feel as if that may be part of the fact that we was just not very good at teaching. We would get through 4 problems in a power lecture and many times he would mess up and say we didn't have enough time to go back. You don't learn anything from him you have to teach yourself all of the material.
